title: Restore empty tableau column drop zone after last-card move

requirements.summary: Ensure empty tableau columns remain visible and usable drag-and-drop targets after their last card is moved to a foundation, enforcing King-only placement per existing rules.
acceptanceCriteria: Given a tableau column becomes empty after moving its last card to a foundation, the UI still shows an empty slot/drop zone in that tableau position (not a blank, non-interactive area).
Dragging a King (or a face-up run starting with a King) from the waste or another tableau pile onto the empty tableau column succeeds and updates the game state correctly.
Dragging a non-King card/run onto an empty tableau column is rejected (state does not change), consistent with existing rules.
The empty tableau drop zone provides the same drag-over highlighting behavior used for other drop targets (when applicable).

file_operations.description: Fix empty-pile rendering so a tableau pile with zero cards still renders a visible, interactive drop zone whenever it is a drop target (including drag-over highlighting and wiring dragOver/dragLeave/drop handlers), instead of returning a non-interactive blank container.

Adjust tableau pile rendering props so empty tableau columns explicitly render the empty-slot UI (e.g., pass isEmpty based on pile length and keep isDropTarget enabled), ensuring the drop zone remains visible immediately after moving the last card out.
